title: EU gives Johnson midnight deadline to cede Brexit ground
text:
London | The chances of Britain and the European Union reaching a Brexit deal by the weekend appear to have receded, with the Europeans giving Prime Minister Boris Johnson until midnight (10am Wednesday AEDT) to yield more ground on the vexed Irish question.

Both sides agree that talks have become more constructive, but progress has once again foundered over the stubborn question of how to avoid building customs infrastructure on the porous and politically vulnerable border between Ireland and the British province of Northern Ireland.

British PM Boris Johnson: Is he on the threshold of a deal or a disaster? Getty

The British government is now refusing to confirm there will be a special parliamentary sitting on Saturday to approve a Brexit deal, as it's unclear that the two sides can reach even in-principle agreement before a scheduled European Council summit of EU leaders on Thursday-Friday.

Hopes were raised last week after a productive meeting between Mr Johnson and his Irish counterpart Leo Varadkar last Thursday. But there are now expectations that a deal might not be struck, if at all, until right before the legal Brexit deadline of October 31 - the date by which Mr Johnson has vowed to quit the EU "come what may".

And that leaves up in the air the question of what Mr Johnson will do on October 19 - the date by which he is legally obliged (thanks to a law passed by opposition parties and Tory rebels) to seek a three-month delay to Brexit, unless he has a deal in his pocket.
description: Prospects seem to be fading that the two sides can get a deal done by this weekend.
